definition.name: julia-version
definition.description: Resolve version specifiers into Julia versions
definition.author: Curtis Vogt

inputs.name: versions
inputs.description: The Julia version specifier or list of specifiers to resolve. Support formats include a scalar, JSON list, or a YAML list. When passing in a scalar prefer using a string instead of a numeric value to avoid unwanted YAML decimal conversions (e.g. `1.10` will be interpreted as `1.1`).

inputs.name: project
inputs.description: The path to the Julia project directory or file to use when resolving some specifiers (e.g. `min`). Defaults to using the environmental variable `JULIA_PROJECT` if set or otherwise `.`.

inputs.name: if-missing
inputs.description: Determine the behavior if a version specifier cannot be resolved.

outputs.name: resolved-json
outputs.description: The unique JSON list of resolved Julia versions. Any versions which could not be resolved will be excluded from this list.

outputs.name: resolved
outputs.description: A single resolved Julia version when the input `versions` contains is a single version specifier. Will be an empty string if version cannot be resolved.

evidence.reasoning: The action resolves version specifiers into specific Julia versions, which is a key aspect of managing dependencies in a project.
